comments.body: I'm wondering why this needs to be a dependency of `@types/jest`, since Jest ships with its own type declarations now. Can this be removed?

This was added prior to Jest 25 being released. AFAIK, Jest 24’s types were not included.

I’d have to look at how Jest’s built-in typings work before giving an answer to your question.
This is to guard against future changes to the type of `expect.stringContaining`?  Right now, it appears to return `any`, meaning type of `text` will also be `any`.

I took this type from `toHaveDescription` definition because this matcher is supposed to accept the same arguments with `toHaveDescription` - or any other marchers that match text partially.

> This is to guard against future changes to the type of `expect.stringContaining`?

I think yes it does have this effect. And looks like it’s also the reason why it’s used in `toHaveDescription`.
